description: From Latin fascinātus, perfect passive participle of fascinō (“enchant, bewitch, fascinate”), from fascinum (“a phallus-shaped amulet worn around the neck used in Ancient Rome; witchcraft”), which is of obscure origin.

verbs.description: fascinate (third-person singular simple present fascinates, present participle fascinating, simple past and past participle fascinated)

entries.meaning: To evoke an intense interest or attraction in someone.
examples: The flickering TV fascinated the cat.

entries.meaning: To make someone hold motionless; to spellbind.
examples: We were fascinated by the potter's skill.

entries.meaning: To be irresistibly charming or attractive to.
